website_summaries.verdict: Despite a couple of minor design issues, this is widely considered to be a durable and reliable option.
pros: Easy to load, and feels great in the hand
cons: In addition to some complaints over the poor design of its safety feature, some buyers have reported that the depth adjuster sometimes gets stuck

customer_reviews.title: Junk Staple Gun. Look Elsewhere!
customer_reviews.text: I went through about 1000 staples putting down 1/4" plywood underlayment for a new vinyl floor. No two consecutive staples were set at a consistent depth. One staple would blow clear through the plywood, while the very next one would stick 1/2" above the surface. This happened over and over again. My compressor held constant PSI. I tried adjusting the staple gun depth setting and the compressor regulator with no luck. Returned this POS for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Ryan

customer_reviews.title: An Excellent Gun
customer_reviews.text: In the month that I've owned this, I've fired over 10k staples into a variety of materials without a single misfire. Fastener is always properly sunk, excellent feel in the hand. As a commercial cabinetmaker, I'd offer that you won't find at better gun at double this price point. The only one I ever used that I honestly liked better was a Grex, but this weighs half that and seems to drive as well. Longevity is the only remaining question now, and I am optimistic. Pros: Lightweight Remaining fasteners clearly visible (no cute window) Durable (survived a few drop tests already) Cons: None, really.
customer_reviews.author: egm7691

customer_reviews.title: I had to drop it down to 45PSI and it worked fine. If you're worrying about this thing not having ...
customer_reviews.text: The depth adjustment doesn't really do too much and running this thing at the 70PSI it recommends as the minimum in the manual shoots my 3/4" staples (Senco L11BAB) right through the material I want to staple at the shallowest depth setting. I had to drop it down to 45PSI and it worked fine. If you're worrying about this thing not having enough power to drive them flush, don't. The thing works like a charm in both single and bump mode, I used it to staple PEX floor heating plates up and put in about 2000 staples with zero issues. Not a single jam.
customer_reviews.author: Charmaine N.

customer_reviews.title: Flawless so far!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool! I work in set construction for a community theater and I use this to attach 1/4" plywood to 2x2 frames to make walls and set pieces with 1 1/4" staples. I've used lots of air fastening tools and this is my favorite so far. I've shot more than 2,000 staples without any problems. I like the bump-fire option. The tool comfortable to use and has not misfired or jammed or anything but performed flawlessly. The magazine is easy and quick to load and it is easy to see how many staples are left. Mine came with a good case and pair of safety glasses. You'll also need oil.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Diffrent name but still great quality
customer_reviews.text: I own mostly Senco brand nail/staple guns. I needed a small staple gun like this one for light duty use to replace a cheap Porter Cable that I never cared for that finally broke and could not be repaired. This gun is light and has features someone using a small stapler might and find handy as we have. The price is a great deal as far as I can tell. Service time in the shop will tell as my Senco guns go years without problems. We hope this one will also. If your going to staple a lot of hard woods over 1 inch thick, think of a heavier gun
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Nailed It! aka Stapled It.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a narrow crown stapler capable of using 1 1/2" staples. I have used Dewalt, Porter-Cable and others and was leaning that way when I searched for a new one with longer staple capacity. The price on this one at $79 stood out and I am familiar with Metabo and Hitachi, so I decided to give it a try. My first staple was more than a 1/2" proud. I adjusted the depth gauge to full depth and still lacked 1/4". I increased the air pressure to 100 psi and finally got the staples flush with my underlayment. I drove close to 200 staples and every one was either flush or a bit below the surface.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! I bought this tool to fasten a sub floor and it slammed the staples in with no problems. I've got a half dozen other projects around the house I'm going to use this for, including a fence and new eaves on my porch. I never would have thought how useful this tool was until I actually used it. Highly recommended for any DIYer.
customer_reviews.author: This guy

customer_reviews.title: Not for the easily aggravated, or those that just want to shoot staples.
customer_reviews.text: ordered this to replace a porter cable narrow crown stapler that failed. the safety on this stapler is a horrible 2 piece design. if you cant get the safety exactly square to the workpiece, it wont fire. this stapler is practically unuseable for picture frames. It also has a tendency to misfire, and I was only able to get an average of 1 in 3 staples to fire. It is going back, and I am just going to spend the money on a rebuild kit for the porter cable.
customer_reviews.author: brian hammett

customer_reviews.title: very powerful!
customer_reviews.text: this is very powerful. i figured this was an ok stapler and would be good for stapling some garden fabric into a planter box. too strong, tried dialing it down and still drove the staples through the material. i was wondering why it said that it could do 1 1/2 inch staples, now i know. i am very impressed with this tool and now have a whole different idea about what i can use it for. my only complaint is that it DOES NOT COME WITH STAPLES. fortunately i ordered some at the same time and they came a few days later.
customer_reviews.author: grendelskeeper

customer_reviews.title: Sometime a nail just won't work
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to staple a weather strip that came free from my garage door. The strip was overhead and 18 feet long. It was original put up with single head brads. To avoid the rubberized plastic strip from pulling through in hot weather I opted for this stapler. The cost was very reasonable and the reviews were all good so I bought it. I put in probably 40 staples without a single failure. If I never use it again It will be worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Weatherly

customer_reviews.title: Ok, but poor build quality
customer_reviews.text: The instructions on this thing seem to highlight that it jams a lot and after my first 500 staples I can say it does jam and is a sensitive unit. While stapling a cosmetic piece on the outside flew off it appears as though it’s hot glued as shown in the pictures and the glue is not on the gun so the glue did not seal well. I’m not sure if this lack of attention to gluing a cosmetic piece on is a sign of a good manufacturer or a bad manufacturer But I most likely won’t buy this brand again
customer_reviews.author: B Gallagher

customer_reviews.title: chickens be alive
customer_reviews.text: used to staple hardware cloth all around my fat chicken coop. they are all still alive and it holds the wire well in the wood easy to center a staple. good quality tool for the price. i usually buy the green japanese brand but the quality for the price here is a better deal. Its not 100% as good as that other brand but its 90% as good and more than 10% less money.
customer_reviews.author: zelda2011

customer_reviews.title: Too strong, hard to dial in.
customer_reviews.text: I am giving this a 2 stars, it’s light weight, easy to use, but the strike force is too strong, and I dialed it all the way down, all I could do is use my hand with a gentle touch, that was the only way for me to not tear the molding apart. I tried it on 2x 4 and this thing just bang it hard. Way too hard.
customer_reviews.author: DavidAndIan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent performance at a very good price
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the stapler for over a month now and have found it to be an excellent tool and well worth the price. It is very easy to load and to use. Although lightweight it feels very substantial. There have been no jams with any of the brands of staples. I use it mainly for home and farm maintenance and some very amateur woodworking.
customer_reviews.author: michael lowery

customer_reviews.title: Super handy nailer!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a motorhome restoration project, but now I'm finding all sorts of uses for it! Super handy, like a brad nailer but much better holding power. It has become my go to stapler/light duty nailer.
customer_reviews.author: Grease Monkey

customer_reviews.title: Well built, feels good in use,  and the great hitachi build quality.
customer_reviews.text: Well made stapler. Easy to use. As a house builder I use all kinds of fasteners and have many Hitachi built guns. I have come to rely heavily on them. This is my latest buy. It replaces an old very well used Hilti narrow crown stapler that is no longer supported with replacement parts. So far, I’ve used both 1/2 and 1&3/8 staples. Didn’t have one misfire. I’m happy.
customer_reviews.author: Paul R. Haller

customer_reviews.title: Not a good product for finishing applications
customer_reviews.text: I’m so very sorry I bought this stapler so far prior to needing to use it. It’s a really poor finish tool and will not function reliably at low pressure in fine finishing applications. I replaced it with a Banks unit for less than half the price from Harbor Freight that has performed flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Hank Brown

customer_reviews.title: Cannot say anything bad about this gun
customer_reviews.text: I use this gun rebuilding a stick built travel trailer and after putting several hundred 1.5 inch staples through it the gun has not jammed once and has sunk all staples flush. At least for a DIYer this gun is perfect, IMO.
customer_reviews.author: Slowdog

customer_reviews.title: Quality tool!
customer_reviews.text: First off, let me say that I am glad that I didn't buy a similar item at one of the big box stores. The prices on Amazon are 20%+ less expensive. Anyways, I used this to put together frames for our beehives this weekend and it certainly did not disappoint. I ran it at 70 psi and 1in staples went completely into the pine frames. As one user said, this thing could be overpowered unless you play with the psi or adjust the drive depth (I haven't messed with this feature). All in all, it does exactly what I wanted it to do and it appears to be quality tool that I expect to get years of use from.
customer_reviews.author: Ned B. Palmer

customer_reviews.title: solid heavy duty tool
customer_reviews.text: other nice thing about this is Hitachi - if you're doing near-flush to the wall stapling, there is no overhang on the tool that gets in the way. i had no problems doing some intricate trim on an antique china cabinet today
customer_reviews.author: FetvusForTheRestuvus

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to love this gun
customer_reviews.text: Love the gun but the safety is horrible. I had a porter cable forever but they changed there design so I bought this one. I build cabinets so I use thus gun for 10 hrs everyday. The safety goes all the way around the tip and is so loose you can't tell where you are going to hit. I am going try something else
customer_reviews.author: ktheaton

customer_reviews.title: As Far as I can Tell, a Great Stapler
customer_reviews.text: Just stapled down a subfloor with this puppy. Worked as expected and flawlessly. I lubricated before use as recommended and used name brand staples and didn't have any jams putting in 1000, or so, staples.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan L Heal

customer_reviews.title: I had issues with it driving too deep but fixed that
customer_reviews.text: and now the staples go in perfectly. Interestingly enough, I had to lower the psi to 50. But now it works and I'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Works PERFECTLY.
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly, even without Hitachi brand staples. Although my only issue was the very first staple shot caused the glued on name plate to fall off. There was oil on the metal underneath, so of course it didn't adhere properly. Other than that, 0 issues.
customer_reviews.author: Quillson

customer_reviews.title: Great staple gun
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and powerful. You don't get fatigued using this gun but it drives staples well. Replaced another brand that had failed and the rebuild kit for the other gun was more money than buying this gun new. This is a much better gun.
customer_reviews.author: waitingForTheStorm

customer_reviews.title: Great unit
customer_reviews.text: Ive owned senco , ridgid , porter cable . This by far the best , it takes oil to keep it luber . Where most are non oiling so they dont last and if the air source has any moisture they dont last ..these that you oil will last . I use mine daily stapeling drywall cornerbead
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Well made and great price
customer_reviews.text: Works wonderfully, well made and full featured. Everything I was looking for and more at a very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Speed Racer 5

customer_reviews.title: Very light and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: So far I have run about 1000 staples through it. I oil it every morning and have only had it jam once (I think that was more due to cheap staples). No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great so far!
customer_reviews.text: I have only had this stapler for a few weeks, and only used it on one small project and only one size staple (the largest), but it has performed admirably thus far, without any jams. Loading the staples is very simple, and can easily be seen from the outside making it very east to judge how many staples are left which helps to avoid dry fires. I will update this if anything changes, but it likely won't given how well my other Hitachi nail guns have performed over longer periods of time.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Hinds

customer_reviews.title: It works great!
customer_reviews.text: I used to drive nearly 1000 staples on one project. It did not jam once. It is easy to operate, and it's easy to load more staples. The included instructions (I did not have to get on a computer and download them!) walked me through the process of setting the drive depth. The included case is nice. used: 7/8" staples air pressure: 90 psi
customer_reviews.author: John Inman

customer_reviews.title: I did my research and this one was highly recommend for the price
customer_reviews.text: My last stable gun broke son I needed a new one. I did my research and this one was highly recommend for the price. It was cheaper than Home Depot or Loew's. The gun works great and drives stables into the wood with no problem. I also bought this because of the brand name and the fact it will handle 1 1/2 stables. Very easy to load the stables. The rubber tip to protect the material from being marred is another great feature.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick O'Connor

customer_reviews.title: SUPER STAPLER!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have recently had two cheaper guns go out on me in the past 2 months. Was glad to get this one with the nipple already installed and ready to go. Slapped some staples in and ran it through a whole 2 rows. One on single fire and one rapid. Never a misfire or one that didn't drive completely. These were 1" long. The 1-1/2" staples showed up today and I'll be running the same test again today with them.
customer_reviews.author: RLD 1427Top Contributor: Welding

customer_reviews.title: Best stapler ever
customer_reviews.text: I am a cabinet maker and needed a good staple gun. This is incredible. It will take any brand staple I put through it, I can’t tell you how many times it’s been dropped, I oil it very little and it just keeps working! Highly recommend, only downside is the Exhaust Port came off and will not stay on but no big deal to me
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Gutierrez

customer_reviews.title: Piece of crap
customer_reviews.text: Thing jammed up on the third shot so I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Kal the Handyman

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Great bang for the buck. So far it works great and I love the big gun approach to the loading of the clip and ability to see the staples. Light weight , side angle air nipple for easy hose on off, In short this is really a superior design.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Levinson

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic stapler
customer_reviews.text: Put it to work rescreening an entire gazebo. Pushed 1000 staples through it and not a single jam or misfire Fantastic product
customer_reviews.author: Bob G

customer_reviews.title: Stop looking for a crown stapler. Buy this one.
customer_reviews.text: If you are doing small jobs this stapler is for you. It is not oiless. It is light. You can see the crown staples in the clip. If you plan on doing big jobs and want to eat through a lot of staples before you reload then I'd get a contractor grade stapler. Otherwise, DIYer's this is the crown stapler you want.
customer_reviews.author: RoBoCo

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong
customer_reviews.text: Exceptional value. After about 400 staples not a single jam or misfire. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: louis

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend !
customer_reviews.text: Excellent crown stapler. Relatively easy to adjust and had no jams during my fencing project. It is my second Hitachi product and I've been very happy with both. Will definetly buy a Hitachi again when the need arises.
customer_reviews.author: B. Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this choice
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, but not in a "cheap" way... more like in a "quality design and thoughtful choice of materials" way.
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey The Great

customer_reviews.title: Buy with confidence!
customer_reviews.text: Best stapler on the market for the money. We use these extensively and own 4 of them. They last us around 2 yrs of heavy use. People that have given them low marks do not know how to use or they received a lemon.
customer_reviews.author: mike caudill

customer_reviews.title: Hitachi N3804AB3 1 1/2" 18-Gauge Narrow Crown Finish Stapler
customer_reviews.text: I am replacing my Senco 11 oiless stapler. I have had it sence 1989. I had it rebuilt 7 yrs. ago. It needs to be rebuilt again. I disided to get the Hitachi because I purchased the 2" brad shooter a cupple of years ago and it had all the features of senco plus a FIVE year warranty. No other company has this that I know of and the stapler works great. I am a carpenter by trade. You can't go wrong with this gun.
customer_reviews.author: eslarry

customer_reviews.title: Great Company!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product, it is well worth the money. I used it with one and a half inch staples and it attached plywood to a two by four without a problem. The service from this company is second to none. They were very quick to respond to any questions I had for them. Quick delivery and a quality product, make this stapler and company easy to recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: Michael La Rosa

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and easy to handle
customer_reviews.text: Worked great right out of the box. Have only used hitachi brand staples so I can’t comment on the reliability with any other brands. Used this to put up shingles on a shed and was able to adjust the depth to be flush with the shingle every time.
customer_reviews.author: Steven LaViano

customer_reviews.title: Great for stapling plywood to maple and maple to pine ...
customer_reviews.text: Mostly use other brands but wanted to try this one. After 40 years of installing cabinets it works well. just a little light on power when stapling maple to maple. Great for stapling plywood to maple and maple to pine cleats. The safety gets a little into the way when using behind face frames. It is light and easy to use all day at work.
customer_reviews.author: Stc2581

customer_reviews.title: Not the best!
customer_reviews.text: Hardly works. Right out of packing it would missfire more times than not!
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: Pr
customer_reviews.text: Would like to see metal instead of plastic on the nail and staple holder. It still works very well.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: I have two other Matabo (Hatachi) air tools and this one is great. Just like the others. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Roy Warren

customer_reviews.title: Great Hitachi stapler!!!  Made building my fence fun!!!
customer_reviews.text: This was my first stapler and I am very happy. I have put almost 4,000 staples through it and so far am very happy. A well constructed piece and easy to use. I built a fence with it using this stapler and used 18 gauge inch and a half staples with a 1/4" crown and it worked great. I love the case and included glasses too. I am VERY happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: HistoryOfTheYankeesDOTcom

customer_reviews.title: It does the job
customer_reviews.text: My husband says it does the job. He’s retired now, so this will be for occasional use.
customer_reviews.author: Living in the rain

customer_reviews.title: It's really good
customer_reviews.text: I had a Senco staple gun, but this for me is much better
customer_reviews.author: Luis Botello

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to aide in putting up a fence. It has worked great thus far. I have ran at least 500 staples through it and haven't had a jam yet, or any issues for that matter.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good tool
customer_reviews.text: Contact point is a bit different on this tool. At first glance I wasn’t sure, but the function is spot on. You can place a staple right in a tight corner very accurately. Pretty happy so far
customer_reviews.author: Wood Master

customer_reviews.title: Hitachi N3804AB3
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent stapler. I was somewhat disappointed it didn't have a belt clip. I purchased a Senco belt clip now it's nearly a perfect gun
customer_reviews.author: sparsparkster

customer_reviews.title: excellent product
customer_reviews.text: no doubt the best narrow crown stapler i have ever used.....operates flawlessly
customer_reviews.author: rk

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: Construction is solid and feels like it will last. Depth adjustment is fairly coarse but this isn’t for fine work.
customer_reviews.author: Yun Fong Loh

customer_reviews.title: Perhaps too much power. I had to dial way ...
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps too much power. I had to dial way back to keep from putting staples right through a carpet runner I was installing on some stairs.
customer_reviews.author: D. Worth

customer_reviews.title: First time using it, I had some issues with ...
customer_reviews.text: First time using it, I had some issues with staples not coming out. I had to pull the trigger a couple times every once in a while, probably 1 in 10.
customer_reviews.author: J. Loomis

customer_reviews.title: Good unit
customer_reviews.text: I installed plastic over wall insulation and it worked well
customer_reviews.author: John Gasser

customer_reviews.title: Great little stapler
customer_reviews.text: I needed a narrow crown stapler and decided to go with this one after reading some reviews. I've only used it on one project thus far and have had no issues. It seems to be well made and I had no issues with misfiring.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BumpFire or Trigger fire - that is the question - You Choose!
customer_reviews.text: Great little stapler. Nice to add to the collection- love the option to bump fire or trigger fire. Wish I had it 20 years ago on the rest of my projects
customer_reviews.author: D. Moore

customer_reviews.title: As I expect of an Hitachi nailer - well made, well designed, great price.
customer_reviews.text: I've owned Bostitch nailers and Hitachi nailers. I only buy Hitachi pneumatic nailers now. No magic involved, just simple and well-designed tools at a great price
customer_reviews.author: Nathan J. Harder

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and does the job in a professional manner
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and a great lightweight professional stapler. Love it
customer_reviews.author: D. Arredondo

customer_reviews.title: Hitachi Nailers Are the Best I've Used.
customer_reviews.text: I have never purchased a Hitachi product that I didn't like. This stapler is no exception.
customer_reviews.author: Rev Rider

customer_reviews.title: Probably the best nailer I've used
customer_reviews.text: Probably the best nailer I've used. Won't jam and fires every time. Nice to also have two modes of nailing one for a single trigger pull and another for multiple touch nailing.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick M.

customer_reviews.title: The Best or Nothing
customer_reviews.text: Hitachi for pneumatic tools or just don't bother with it at all.
customer_reviews.author: Professor B

customer_reviews.title: very good
customer_reviews.text: I have been using one of these staplers at work for several years. So when I decided to get a stapler for myself I didn't hesitate to buy exactly the same one I use every day. I would say that I have maybe had 3 or 4 misfired (tangled) staples in probably 100,000 or more shots.
customer_reviews.author: Natural

customer_reviews.title: Fine little gun
customer_reviews.text: Very precise depth adjustment. I also find it easier to place the staple exactly where I want it, far easier than my Bostitch that recently died a violent death( blew up internally). When you are stapling 1/4" ply onto a cabinet carcass, accurate placement is very important.
customer_reviews.author: John M

customer_reviews.title: In my cabinet shop we've gone through many staplers and ...
customer_reviews.text: In my cabinet shop we've gone through many staplers and this Hitachi is a real winner. A third of the weight, smaller size and durability have made this my go to stapler in the future. I just bought a second one as another of my "pro" staplers failed again. Cheaper to buy these instead of fixing those.
customer_reviews.author: Pete M.

customer_reviews.title: great operation. Use it when an 18 ga brad ...
customer_reviews.text: Right price, great operation. Use it when an 18 ga brad just doesn't provide enough hold (bird houses, carpenter bee traps, lattice). This is the second one I have purchased (loaned the first one, haven't seen it in awhile).
customer_reviews.author: Richard Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: I love how light weight it is and easy to use. I put it to work the same day that I got it and not once have I had a misfire. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Fernando cortez

customer_reviews.title: Great value, great function
customer_reviews.text: Good in the hand, clever and simple staple loading mechanism. Nice hard rubber tip protectors (2) provided - appreciated that. And about $100 less than what you’ll pay for comparable quality/function at Lowes or Home Depot.
customer_reviews.author: micfree

customer_reviews.title: New name same quality
customer_reviews.text: The new Metabo has the same quality as the Hitachi. It is great that the quality did not change.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Soetoro

customer_reviews.title: Hitachi 1/4" Narrow Crown Stapler
customer_reviews.text: This tool worked great to make two wood duck nest boxes.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Reams

customer_reviews.title: works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Great buy, I'm siding all day everyday and I've used other guns that are allot heavier and use larger staples, I find this is just as good. Light and fast, it has jammed up once but so far they all do, it's still going strong , worth every cent.
customer_reviews.author: Mama of two

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: The up side is not to have to switch triggers to change fireing mode. The only down side was the depth adjustment tends to stick when turned all the way to one side or the other. Still seems to be the better choice over the others.
customer_reviews.author: Carl H.

customer_reviews.title: Stapling beast!
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a gift for my husband, and he finds every excuse to use it. He says it's excellent, it's lighter weight but doesn't compromise on sturdiness or reliability.
customer_reviews.author: Ali

customer_reviews.title: Reliable Performance
customer_reviews.text: This is a great stapler. I use my air tools every day and my Hitachi stapler performs well every time. Reliable performance, lightweight, seems well built. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Is it Wield that I Kiss My Air Tools after a Job Well Done?
customer_reviews.text: I like that the shot style is selectable. This is a great stapler that works great. I don't really like the way the staples load, that is my biggest complaint. I put up with that though.
customer_reviews.author: NateKnows

customer_reviews.title: Just a great tool that saved me hours of hand nailing sub ...
customer_reviews.text: Just a great tool that saved me hours of hand nailing sub floor down. Well over 1000 staples. never miss fired nor jammed. Light weight. I wish I would have bought one before.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph A. Lorenzo

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Light and easy to use. Installed siding on my house.
customer_reviews.author: Pam Morrisett

customer_reviews.title: Quality alert!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my business and use it daily. It surprised me how well it has performed since the cost was relatively low. I have never experienced even one jam or malfunction and have been using it for the past year. It's not an oil free gun so you do need to add a couple of drops per day but, big deal. Takes standard staples (Porter Cable, Senco, etc.)
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Posey

customer_reviews.title: Good workhorse
customer_reviews.text: So far this stapler has worked like a charm. The first big project is complete and not a single jam. It drives the staples deep, so take some time to adjust the pressure. Soft woods like cedar and pine are not an issue. I haven't used it on hardwoods yet. Other than needing a belt loop, this is a quality tool. The movable air port on top is great and really is a usable feature especially when using the stapler in awkward or tight places.
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: light weight, easy to use, great value for the money
customer_reviews.text: My old porter cable crown stapler broke not worth fixing so I saw the Hitachi on Amazon for a great price bought it and I'm glad I did. Great product so far.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Pucilowski

customer_reviews.title: Stapler neumatic
customer_reviews.text: We bought this stapler to make a King upolstered headboard. The old saying is pick the project by the new tool it requires. It worked great and never failed. Hitachi quality - as usual - excellent price. Recommend purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. Low pressure is great
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Low pressure is great. Easy to load.
customer_reviews.author: J. Singer

customer_reviews.title: tried other brands but always seem to go back to ...
customer_reviews.text: tried other brands but always seem to go back to hitachi for my nail guns, top quality and built to last..
customer_reviews.author: Mike Myers

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: I have other staplers but this is the caddy of staplers. very lightweight but lots of power. I use it both for auto nailing and spot nailing. no marks with a small hole. More expensive than other staplers.
customer_reviews.author: stevo

customer_reviews.title: ... used this for over a year still works as good as when I bought
customer_reviews.text: I am a contractor and have used this for over a year still works as good as when I bought it
customer_reviews.author: chris callahan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect tool and good value.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent reliable staple gun. Couldn't think of a way to make it better. Invaluable for building a chicken coop, for example.
customer_reviews.author: DJR

customer_reviews.title: Great Stapler
customer_reviews.text: No miss-fires and worked well. Only drawback is stapler requires lubrication. Light easy to use, depth of staple was not as accurate as I hoped but I like it for the price.
customer_reviews.author: malefic

customer_reviews.title: very happy with all of them
customer_reviews.text: Have several Hitachi guns, very happy with all of them. Until now they all have been trouble free, and you can't beat the price!
customer_reviews.author: Jack B Nimble

customer_reviews.title: Great stapler
customer_reviews.text: One of the best pneumatic fasteners I've ever used. Light weight but solid, clear view of the magazine and has never failed to drive the longest staples to full depth.
customer_reviews.author: greg crawford

customer_reviews.title: Good to go the next time
customer_reviews.text: Never had an issue with these. Keep them oiled and clean them up a little after use. Good to go the next time. Very light to handle.
customer_reviews.author: Allen T.

customer_reviews.title: Stop looking! Buy this!
customer_reviews.text: This thing rocks! A friend has a Chinese copy that I borrowed. Junk! I have a Hitachi finish nailer so I thought a Hitachi stapler would be a good bet. Amazing! I use 3/4" and 1-1/4" staples and it works awesome! No Jams! My wife loves it too!
customer_reviews.author: Donnie207

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Quick and easy assembly of many projects, paid for itself the first job I had. However, finding the 1/4" crown staples in desired lengths may take a little searching. Worth the effort.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Richards

customer_reviews.title: It would probably be better to use a wider crown staple for shingles but ...
customer_reviews.text: I used this stapler to apply cedar shingles on my house. It worked very well. It would probably be better to use a wider crown staple for shingles but they seemed to hold at least as well as the nails I used previously. I don't have a lot of experience with air powered tools.
customer_reviews.author: Skip

customer_reviews.title: Bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: No problem here, this is a great tool to have around saves a bunch of time trying to do it any other way
customer_reviews.author: usetobe1

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I am a contractor and use nail guns daily, this one is tops! Light and powerful.
customer_reviews.author: Syncro

customer_reviews.title: Powerful!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a specific flooring project and it worked great. I had a little trouble turning down the PSI so the staples wouldn't blow through the subfloor laminate. The instructions aren't dummy proof and it took me a little while to get the right PSI.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald E Matson

product_meta.title: Hitachi N3804AB3 1/4" Narrow Crown Stapler, 18 Gauge, ½-Inch to 1-1/2-Inch Staple Length
product_meta.description:
Ergonomically designed simple flip actuation switch allows easy transition from single actuation to contact actuation Tool-free depth adjustment allows for a professional finish with varying materials- simple dial in the desired depth and efficiently finish the job Equipped with a non-slip elastomer grip trigger Tool-less, easy to clear nose for quick and simple staple extraction should a staple jam 360 degree adjustable exhaust can be directed away from the user in any direction 2.3 lbs, lightweight and well-balanced for ease of use No-mar tip included to prevent scarring and denting of a work surface Factory installed air fitting is angled upward to conveniently keep the hose away from the user and off the work piece High capacity magazine holds up to 100 staples for maximum efficiency

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The Hitachi N3804AB3 1-1/2-Inch 18-Gauge Narrow Crown Finish Stapler is the ideal stapler for internal and external trim, furniture, cabinet work and other fine finish applications. This stapler weighs only 2.3-pounds and extremely well balanced for ease of use. The simple, tool-free depth of drive adjusts to varying materials for improved control and customization. A selective actuation switch has been added to easily select contact or bump fire actuation. The included no-mar tip protects work surfaces from damage, while the elastomer grip adds comfort and security. In the case of a staple jam, the easy clear nose provides easy access to minimize disruption. The N3804AB3 also features a 360-degree adjustable exhaust. Equipped with an included air fitting, this narrow crown stapler is ready to use right out of the box. The Hitachi N3804AB3 1-1/2-Inch 18-Gauge Narrow Crown Finish Stapler is warranted to the original purchaser to be free from defect in materials and workmanship for a period of 5-years from the original purchase date. Hitachi Power Tools (Hitachi Koki USA, Ltd.) provides professional-grade power tools for a variety of applications, including woodwork, metalwork, concrete, drilling, cutting and fastening. Since its inception, Hitachi has pioneered innovative technologies that have improved the quality of craftsmanship worldwide. Hitachi is a leader in power tool research and development and has achieved many firsts in the power tool industry. Today, Hitachi continues the tradition of innovation and engineering with new features in addition to classic quality.
feature_bullets: Hitachi Power Tools has renamed to Metabo HPT. Same great tools, with only a new name.
